edu.pitt.bank

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.pitt.bank.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    The Transaction class allows creation of new transaction in the database and the loading of existing ones. Dmitriy Babichenko contributed the framework for this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transaction(java.lang.String transactionID)
      This method allows of the loading of existing transactions from the database.
      Transaction(java.lang.String accountID, java.lang.String type, double amount, double balance)
      This constructor allows for the creation of new transactions and their insertions into the proper database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(java.lang.String transactionID)
        This method allows of the loading of existing transactions from the database. You must provide the transactionID.
        Parameters:
        transactionID - - This specifies the transaction you'd like to load

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(java.lang.String accountID,
                   java.lang.String type,
                   double amount,
                   double balance)
        This constructor allows for the creation of new transactions and their insertions into the proper database. The transactionID is created at random using Java's UUID utility. You must specify the various fields in the signature.
        Parameters:
        accountID - - This specifies the account to which this transaction will post
        type - - This specifies the type of transaction it is
        amount - - This specifies the amount of the transaction
        balance - - This specifies the new balance of the account
